required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BeGraft+ as Bridging Stent in BEVAR Investigating the BeGraft+ Stent Graft System as Bridging Stent in BEVAR for Complex Aortic Aneurysms
clinical_study.official_title: Physician-Initiated Trial Investigating the BeGraft+ Stent Graft System as Bridging Stent in BEVAR for Complex Aortic Aneurysms
clinical_study.source: FCRE (Foundation for Cardiovascular Research and Education)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this clinical investigation is to evaluate, in a controlled setting, the safety and performance of the BeGraft+ balloon expandable covered stent Graft System (Bentley Innomed, Hechingen, Germany) implanted as bridging stent in BEVAR (branched endovascular aortic repair) for complex aortic aneurysms

primary_outcome.description: defined as successfully introduction and deployment of the BeGraft Plus balloon expandable covered Stent Graft System implanted as bridging stent in BEVAR

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy endpoint (2) - Bridging stent patency at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: defined as absence of restenosis (≥50% stenosis) or sole target vessel occlusion based on CT angio at 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Safety endpoint - Absence of procedure related complications and bridging stent related endoleaks at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Absence of procedure related complications and bridging stent related endoleaks at 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Bridging stent patency post-op and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: defined as absence of restenosis (≥50% stenosis) or sole target vessel occlusion based on Duplex Ultrasound or CT Angio

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from bridging stent related endoleaks post-op and at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from bridging stent related endoleaks post-op and at 6 months, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound, CT angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from bridging stent related secondary intervention post-op at 6 and 12 months.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from bridging stent related endoleaks post-op and at 6 and 12 months, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound, CT angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from type I & III endoleaks post-procedure post-op and at 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from type I & III endoleaks post-op and at 6 and 12 months, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound, CT angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from stent graft migration post-op and at 6 and 12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: defined as freedom from stent graft migration (more than 10 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from AAA diameter increase at 6 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: defined as more than 5mm increase in maximum diameter measured at 6 and 12 months as compared to post-op implantation, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound or CT Angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from aneurysm related secondary endovascular procedures post-op and at 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from aneurysm related secondary endovascular procedures post-op and at 6 months, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound, CT angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from conversion to open surgical repair post-procedure and at 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from conversion to open surgical repair post-op and at 6 months, based on imaging (duplex ultrasound, CT angiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from aneurysm related mortality post-procedure and at 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from aneurysm rupture within 12 months post-implantation
Freedom from any major adverse events post-procedural and at 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day post-op and at 6 and 12 months post-op

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life scores at 12 months post-implantation by using EQ-5D questionnaire

arm_group.description: BeGraft Plus Stent Graft System as bridging stent in Branched Endovascular Repair (BEVAR) for complex aortic aneurysms

intervention.intervention_name: BeGraft Plus Stent Graft System as bridging stent
intervention.description: BeGraft Plus Stent Graft System as bridging stent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is willing to comply with specified follow-up evaluations at the specified times
- Patient is >18 years old
- Patient understands the nature of the procedure and provides written informed consent, prior to enrolment in the trial
- Patient has a projected life-expectancy of at least 12-months
- Indication of elective repair of TAAA with BEVAR in accordance with the applicable guidelines for vascular interventions
- Patient needs to have a landing zone in their target vessel of at least 15 mm, and coverage/ wall adaptation of the BSG should be obtained for at least 10 mm.
- No early important division branch from the target vessel with risk of coverage
- Absence of dissection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously implanted stent in the target vessel
- Renal artery with >100° cranial orientation
- Patients refusing treatment
- Patients for whom antiplatelet therapy, anticoagulants or thrombolytic drugs are contraindicated
- Patients with uncorrected bleeding disorders or heparin induced thrombocytopenia
- Female patient with child bearing potential not taking adequate contraceptives or currently breastfeeding
- Life expectancy of less than twelve months
- Any planned surgical intervention/procedure within 30 days of the trial procedure
- Any patient considered to be hemodynamically unstable at onset of procedure
- Patient is currently participating in another investigational drug or device trial that has not completed the entire follow up period.
- Patients with diffuse distal disease resulting in poor stent outflow
- Fresh thrombus formation
- Patients with known hypersensitivity to the stent material (L605) and/or PTFE
- Hybrid Approach

overall_official.affiliation: Foundation for Cardiovascular Research and Education

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: FCRE (Foundation for Cardiovascular Research and Education)
